sentences.en: Bad pronunciation is a liability in being a narrator.
sentences.cn: 不良的发音是做解说员的不利条件.

sentences.en: His English is not bad, but his pronunciation isn't too good.
sentences.cn: 他的英语学得不错, 只是发音还不太好.

sentences.en: I thought a phonetic spelling might aid in pronunciation.
sentences.cn: 我想语音拼写可能有助于发音。

sentences.en: My brother's English pronunciation is simply terrible.
sentences.cn: 我兄弟的英语发音实在糟透了.

sentences.en: She gave the word its French pronunciation.
sentences.cn: 她读出了该词的法语发音。

sentences.en: The teacher checks for pronunciation and intonation.
sentences.cn: 老师在检查发音和语调.

sentences.en: The tongue is one of the organs for pronunciation.
The wrong pronunciation of the word is sanctioned by public usage.
sentences.cn: 人们接受了这个字的错误读法,因为大家都这样念.

sentences.en: You're going to have to forgive my pronunciation.

words.tran_cn: 读得出的；可发音的；可断言的
显著的；断然的；讲出来的
发音；宣告；断言（pronounce的过去分词）

trans.tran_en: the way in which a language or a particular word is pronounced
